ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: We bore him on a planked and well-caulked ship,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: But We bore him on a (vessel made) of planks and oakum,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: And We bore Noah on the vessel built of planks and nails,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: We carried him, (Noah), on a vessel built with boards fixed together with nails,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And We carried Nooh upon a ship of wooden planks and nails.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And We carried him on a (ship) made of planks and nails (Dusur)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And We bore him on that which was made of planks and nails
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And We bore him upon a well-planked vessel well-caulked
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And We carried him upon a thing of planks and nails,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: We bore him on an [ark] which, made of planks and nails,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And We bare him on a thing of planks and nails.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: We bore him on a vessel made of planks and nails,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But We bore him on an (Ark) made of broad planks and caulked with palm-fibre:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And We carried him on a (ship) made of planks and nails,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: We carried him in a well built, watertight vessel made from planks (of wood)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And We carried him on a craft of planks and nails.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And We carried him on a [construction of] planks and nails,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [54:13] And We bore him, that is, Noah, on one, a ship, [made] of planks and nails (dusur is what boards are fastened down with of nails and the like; the singular is disār, similar [in pattern] to [kutub] kitāb, ‘book’),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And We carried him) i.e. Noah and those who believed in him (upon a thing of planks and nails) an ark,
